data.title: Novaia i noveishaia istoriia :: Issue 6 :: “Political Anatomy” and the Idea of Public Wealth from William Petty to Adam Smith
data.meta_description: Inthe article, the author attempts to solve three interrelated problems. First, by offering new readings of key texts authored by leading British thinkers and representatives of different strands of s
data.text:
1. Anikin A.V. Yunost' nauki. ZHizn' i idei myslitelei-ekonomistov do Marksa [The youth of science. Life and ideas of economic thinkers before Marx]. Moskva, 1971. (In Russ.)

2. Anikin A.V., Anikin V.A. Uil'yam Petti [William Petty]. Moskva, 1986. (In Russ.)

3. Bacon F. Sochineniya v dvukh tomakh [Works in two volumes] / sost., obshch. red. i vstup. st. A.L. Subbotina. T. 1. Moskva, 1971. (In Russ.)

4. Berkeley J. Sochineniya [Works] / sost., obshch. red. i vstup. st. I.S. Narskogo. Moskva, 2000. (In Russ.)

5. Besedin A.P. Moral'naya filosofiya Berkli i ee razvitie [Berkeley's moral philosophy and its development] // Istoriko-filosofskii ezhegodnik [Historical and Philosophical Yearbook]. 2016. Moskva, 2016. (In Russ.)

6. Marks K., Engels F. Sochineniya [Works]. 2-e izd. T. 23; T. 26. Ch. 1. (In Russ.)

7. Petti V. Ekonomicheskie i statisticheskie raboty [Economic and statistical works]. T. I–II / per. pod red. M. Smit. Moskva, 1940. (In Russ.)

8. Ptuha M. Ocherki po istorii statistiki XVII–XVIII vekov [Essays on the history of statistics of the 17th–18th centuries]. Moskva, 1945. (In Russ.)

9. Sludkovskaya M.A. Politicheskaya ekonomiya Antuana de Monkret'ena (K 400-letiyu vypuska “Traktata po politicheskoj ekonomii”) [Political Economy of Antoine de Montchretien (To the 400th anniversary of the publication of the “Treatise on Political Economy”)] // Vestnik Moskovskogo universiteta. Ser. 6: Ekonomika [Bulletin of the Moscow University. Series 6: Economics]. 2016. № 2. S. 107–118. (In Russ.)

10. Bacon F. The Works of Francis Bacon / coll. and eds J. Spedding, R.L. Ellis, D.D. Heath. Vol. 1. New York, 1968.

11. Davenant Ch. The Political and Commercial Works of that Celebrated Writer Charles D’Avenant / coll. and rev. by Sir Ch. Whitworth. Vol. 1. London, 1771.

12. Mun Th. England's treasure by foreign trade. Or, the balance of our foreign trade is the rule of our treasure. Written by Thomas Mun of London, Merchant. First Published by his Son in the Year M.DC.LXIV. Glasgow, 1755.

13. North D. Discourses Upon Trade: Principally Directed to the Case of the Interest, Coynage, Clipping, Increase of Money. London, 1691.

14. Smith A. An Inquiry into the Nature and the Causes of the Wealth of Nations. Book IV. Ch. 1. Indianapolis (Indiana), 1981.

15. Sprat T. The History of the Royal Society of London. For the Improving of Natural Knowledge. 3rd ed., corrected. London, 1722.

16. Strauss E. Sir William Petty. Portrait of a Genius. London, 1954.

17. The Economic Writings of Sir William Petty / ed. C.H. Hull. Vol. 1. Cambridge, 1899.

18. The Works of George Berkeley, D.D.; Formerly Bishop of Cloyne, Including his Post-humous Works / ed. A. Campbell Fraser: in 4 vols. Oxford, 1901.

19. Waddell D. Charles Davenant (1656–1714). A Biographical Sketch // Economic History Review. New Series. 1958. Vol. 11. № 2. P. 279–288.
